title: Externally Studentized Midrange Distribution
text: SMR R packago aim compute studentized normal midrange distribution. 2017, distribution published Revista Ciência e Agrotecnologia. work developed master Statistics Agricultural Experimentation, Federal University Lavras (UFLA/BRAZIL). authors work Professor Daniel Furtado Ferreira Ben Dêivide de Oliveira Batista, Professor Statistics Federal University São João del-Rei (UFSJ/BRAZIL). Today, collaboration student scientific initiation, Diego Arthur Bispo Justino de Oliveira, student Mechatronics Engineering UFSJ Matheus Fernando Rodrigues Santos, student Mechatronics Engineering UFSJ. package published 2014 R journal

title: Externally Studentized Midrange Distribution
text: install SMR package via CRAN: install via GitHub:

title: Externally Studentized Midrange Distribution
text: package follows structure probability functions implemented R. : probability density function (dSMR), cumulative distribution function (pSMR), quantile function (qSMR) random number generating function (rSMR). pseudocodes illustrative examples use package presented.

title: Externally Studentized Midrange Distribution
text: Version 2.0.2 (development): Version 2.0.0 (2014-10-16): Version 2.0.0 (2014-10-16): Version 1.0.0 (2012-10-19): Functions implemented: dSMR, pSMR, qSMR rSMR.

what: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
title: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
text: Computes probability density, cumulative distribution function quantile function generates random samples  externally studentized normal midrange distribution numbers means equal size, degrees freedom equal df number  points Gauss-Legendre quadrature equal np.

title: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
code: dSMR(x, size, df, np=32, log = FALSE) pSMR(q, size, df, np=32, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE) qSMR(p, size, df, np=32, eps = 1e-13, maxit = 5000, lower.tail = TRUE, log.p = FALSE) rSMR(n, size,  df = Inf)

title: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
text: x, q vector quantiles \(x \R\) \(q \R\). p vector probabilities \((0, 1)\). size sample size.  \(size > 1\). n vector size simulated \(n > 1\). df degrees freedom \(df > 0\). np number points gaussian quadrature \(np > 2\). log, log.p logical argument; TRUE, probabilities \(p\) given \(log(p)\). lower.tail logical argument; TRUE, probabilities \(P[X \leq x]\) otherside, \(P[X \geq x].\) eps stopping criterion Newton-Raphson's iteraction method. maxit maximum number interaction Newton-Raphson method.

title: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
text:
Assumes np = 32 default value dSMR,  pSMR qSMR. df specified, assumes default value Inf rSMR. df=1, convergence routines requires np>250 obtain desired result  accurately. Midrange distribution density $$f(\overline{q};n,
u) =\int^{\infty}_{0} \int^{x\overline{q}}_{-\infty}2n(n-1)x\phi(y) \phi(2x\overline{q}-y)[\Phi(2x\overline{q}-y)-\Phi(y)]^{n-2}f(x;
u)dydx,$$ , \(q\) quantile  externally studentized midrange distribution, \(n\) (size) sample size \(
u\) degrees freedon.  externally studentized midrange distribution function given $$ F(\overline{q};n,
u)=\int^{\overline{q}}_{-\infty} \int^{\infty}_{0}\int^{x\overline{q}}_{-\infty}2n(n-1)x\phi(y) \phi(2xz-y)[\Phi(2xz-y)-\Phi(y)]^{n-2}f(x;
u)dydxdz. $$ , \(q\) quantile  externally studentized  midrange distribution, \(n\) (size) sample size \(
u\) degrees freedon.

title: The externally studentized normal midrange distribution — SMR
text: dSMR gives density, pSMR gives cumulative distribution function, qSMR gives quantile function, rSMRgenerates random deviates.
